content.question: Respond to parts A, B, C, D, and all subparts. (a) Preserving high-quality agricultural land is important so that countries can grow enough food to feed their populations.

frqParts.text: Respond to parts A, B, C, D, and all subparts. (a) Preserving high-quality agricultural land is important so that countries can grow enough food to feed their populations.
(i) Describe one agricultural practice that can lead to the degradation of agricultural land.
(ii) Describe a potential solution or technique that can prevent or reduce degradation of agricultural land.

(b) A less developed country with a rapidly expanding urban population is concerned that its growing urban population will eventually expand to a level where there would not be enough land to grow the food it needs to support its population.
(i) Excluding importing food, propose a solution to address the concerns of reduced land on which to grow food.
(ii) For your solution in (b)(i), explain an additional potential advantage of the solution.

(c) A table for the population size in the country is shown below.Population Size from 2009 to 2017YearPopulation Size (millions)2009<math alttext="2.7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.7</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>2010<math alttext="2.8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>2011<math alttext="3.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>2012<math alttext="3.3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>2013<math alttext="3.6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>2014<math alttext="3.9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.9</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>2015<math alttext="4.2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4.2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>2016<math alttext="4.4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4.4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>2017<math alttext="4.6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
(i) Based on the table, calculate the percent change of the population size in this country between 2009 and 2017. Show your work.

(d) An average person in the country needs <math alttext="2,450" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>450</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> kilocalories <math alttext="kilocalorie per day" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>kcal</mtext><mo>)</mo><mo>/</mo><mtext>day</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> of food to meet their full nutritional needs. The average number of <math alttext="kilocalorie" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>kcal</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> per hectare <math alttext="hectare" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>ha</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> produced from available food in the country is <math alttext="15,737,000 kilocalorie per hectare" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>15</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>737</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kcal</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>ha</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
(i) Calculate the amount of land that would be needed to produce enough kilocalories to feed a person for one year in this developing country. Show your work.
(ii) Calculate how much land would have been needed to feed the population of this country in 2017. Show your work.
